election_record.label: Virginia 1824 Electoral College

overview.note: "From Virginia, we have received the result of the Electoral Election in only the above counties. If any surprize should be felt at the small number of votes given, it must be recollected that freeholders alone vote in this State. The vote, however, is a very small one compared with the number of freeholders in those counties. In Fairfax, less than one third of the qualified voters gave their suffrages, and in Orange it is believed, the disproportion was equally great. -- This may be accounted for by the entire confidence of the friends of Mr. Crawford in his success in the state, which doubtless induced many of those most distant from the courthouses (where alone the votes are received in Virginia) to absent themselves from the polls. The votes for the other candidates exhibit, it is presumed, a pretty accurate view of the number of their supporters, as it is the characteristic of minorities to rally all their power in political contests." Richmond Enquirer (Richmond, VA). November 9, 1824.
TheUnited States' Telegraph -- Extra (1828) lists William H. Brodnax, Joseph Wyatt and Daniel Morgan as electors who voted. It does not list Smith Slaughter, Mark Alexander or John Purnall.

The Fincastle Mirror (Fincastle, VA) listing of electors on the Jackson ticket lists Capt. William Burton of Accomack, while the Western Volunteer and Franklin Gazette (Philadelphia, PA) list Capt. William Benton of Accomack.
The Fincastle Mirror (Fincastle, VA), October 15, does not list Ralph Berkshire but instead lists David M. Hoge.
The Franklin Gazette (Philadelphia, PA), August 5, lists the name Lemuel E. Davis as Lemuel E. Davison. Fincastle Mirror (Fincastle, VA), October 15, lists the name as Lemuel E. Davisson.

sub_unit.name: Albermarle
sub_unit.note: The Constitutional Whig (Richmond, VA), November 16 lists 220 votes for William H. Crawford, 5 votes for John Quincy Adams, 0 votes for Andrew Jackson, and 6 votes for Henry Clay.

sub_unit.name: Alleghany
sub_unit.note: The Fincastle Mirror (Fincastle, VA), November 19 lists 6 votes for John Quincy Adams.

sub_unit.name: Amelia
sub_unit.note: The Fincastle Mirror (Fincastle, VA), November 19; and American, and Commercial Daily Advertiser (Baltimore, MD) lists 130 votes for William H. Crawford.
The Intelligencer (Lexington, VA), November 13 lists 180 votes for William H. Crawford.

sub_unit.name: Amherst
sub_unit.note: The Intelligencer (Lexington, VA), November 13 lists 140 votes for William H. Crawford.

The Alexandria Gazette and Advertiser (Alexandria, VA), American, and Commercial Daily Advertiser (Baltimore, MD), and Baltimore Patriot and Mercantile Advertiser (Baltimore, MD). lists 76 votes for John Quincy Adams.

sub_unit.name: Botetourt
sub_unit.note: The Intelligencer (Lexington, VA), November 13 lists 49 votes for Andrew Jackson.

sub_unit.name: Campbell
sub_unit.note: The Constitutional Whig (Richmond, VA), November 9; Fincastle Mirror (Fincastle, VA), November 12; The Intelligencer (Lexington, VA), November 13; and The Knoxville Register (Knoxville, TN) lists 146 votes for John Quincy Adams.

The Alexandria Gazette and Advertiser (Alexandria, VA), American, and Commercial Daily Advertiser (Baltimore, MD), and Baltimore Patriot and Mercantile Advertiser (Baltimore, MD). lists 147 votes for John Quincy Adams and 15 for votes Jackson.

sub_unit.name: Caroline
sub_unit.note: The Constitutional Whig (Richmond, VA), November 5 lists 0 votes for Andrew Jackson.

sub_unit.name: Charlotte
sub_unit.note: The Constitutional Whig (Richmond, VA), November 9; Fincastle Mirror (Fincastle, VA), November 12; and The Intelligencer (Lexington, VA), November 13, list 200 votes for William H. Crawford, 40 votes for John Quincy Adams and 0 votes for Andrew Jackson.

sub_unit.name: Culpeper
sub_unit.note: The Daily National Intelligencer (Washington, DC), November 6; American, and Commercial Daily Advertiser (Baltimore, MD) and Baltimore Patriot and Mercantile Advertiser (Baltimore, MD). list 200 votes for William H. Crawford, 7 votes for John Quincy Adams and 70 votes for Andrew Jackson.

sub_unit.name: Dinwiddie
sub_unit.note: The American, and Commercial Daily Advertiser (Baltimore, MD) lists 26 votes for John Quincy Adams.

sub_unit.name: Elizabeth City
sub_unit.note: The Constitutional Whig (Richmond, VA), November 9; Daily National Intelligencer (Washington, DC), November 8; Bangor Register, November 18; Fincastle Mirror (Fincastle, VA), November 19; Alexandria Gazette and Advertiser (Alexandria, VA), and American, and Commercial Daily Advertiser (Baltimore, MD) lists 35 votes for William H. Crawford.

sub_unit.name: Essex
sub_unit.note: The Virginia Herald, November 13: "There were 8 other votes taken from other counties, 7 of which for William H. Crawford and 1 for John Quincy Adams, but as they had no freeholds in Essex, are not counted in the above statement."
The Fincastle Mirror (Fincastle, VA), November 12 lists 272 votes for William H. Crawford, 53 votes for John Quincy Adams and 13 votes for Andrew Jackson.

The Daily National Intelligencer (Washington, DC), November 8; The Intelligencer (Lexington, VA), November 13; and American, and Commercial Daily Advertiser (Baltimore, MD) lists 73 votes for William H. Crawford, 53 votes for John Quincy Adams and 13 votes for Andrew Jackson.
The Constitutional Whig (Richmond, VA), November 9 lists 73 votes for William H. Crawford, 13 votes for John Quincy Adams, and 53 votes for Andrew Jackson.
The Richmond Enquirer (Richmond, VA), November 12 lists 73 votes for William H. Crawford, and 14 votes for John Quincy Adams.

sub_unit.name: Fairfax
sub_unit.note: The Daily National Intelligencer (Washington, DC), November 4; Constitutional Whig (Richmond, VA), November 9; Fincastle Mirror (Fincastle, VA), November 12; Richmond Enquirer (Richmond, VA), November 9; Bangor Register, and American, and Commercial Daily Advertiser (Baltimore, MD) lists 76 votes for William H. Crawford.

sub_unit.name: Fauquier
sub_unit.note: The Daily National Intelligencer (Washington, DC), November 6; Bangor Register, November 18; The Intelligencer (Lexington, VA), November 13; and American, and Commercial Daily Advertiser (Baltimore, MD) lists 116 votes for William H. Crawford and 20 votes for John Quincy Adams.
The Intelligencer (Lexington, VA): "Clay received 7 votes in Prince William and 1 in Fauquier."

sub_unit.name: Franklin
sub_unit.note: The Fincastle Mirror (Fincastle, VA), November 19 lists 230 votes for William H. Crawford, 202 votes for John Quincy Adams and 30 votes for Andrew Jackson.

sub_unit.name: Frederick
sub_unit.note: The Daily National Intelligencer, November 8; Fincastle Mirror (Fincastle, VA), November 12; American, and Commercial Daily Advertiser (Baltimore, MD), Baltimore Patriot and Mercantile Advertiser (Baltimore, MD). list 124 votes for William H. Crawford, 87 votes for John Quincy Adams and 280 votes for Andrew Jackson.
The Bangor Register, November 18 lists 129 votes for William H. Crawford, 8 votes for John Quincy Adams and 290 votes for Andrew Jackson.
The Richmond Enquirer (Richmond, VA), November 9 lists 228 votes for Andrew Jackson.
The Constitutional Whig (Richmond, VA), November 9 lists 129 votes for William H. Crawford, and 280 votes for Andrew Jackson.

sub_unit.name: Gloucester
sub_unit.note: The Fincastle Mirror (Fincastle, VA), November 12; The Intelligencer (Lexington, VA), November 13; and American, and Commercial Daily Advertiser (Baltimore, MD) list 160 votes for William H. Crawford, and 40 votes for John Quincy Adams.
The Daily National Intelligencer (Washington, DC), November 8 lists 175 for William H. Crawford, and 45 for John Quincy Adams.

sub_unit.name: Greenbrier
sub_unit.note: The Constitutional Whig (Richmond, VA), November 16 lists 54 votes for William H. Crawford, 70 votes for John Quincy Adams, 0 votes for Andrew Jackson, and 0 votes for Henry Clay.

sub_unit.name: Hardy
sub_unit.note: The Fincastle Mirror (Fincastle, VA), November 19 lists 4 votes for William H. Crawford and 35 votes for John Quincy Adams.

sub_unit.name: Harrison
sub_unit.note: The Richmond Enquirer (Richmond, VA), November 9; and Constitutional Whig (Richmond, VA), November 16, list 44 votes for Henry Clay.

sub_unit.name: Henrico
sub_unit.note: The Fincastle Mirror (Fincastle, VA), November 12 lists 169 votes for William H. Crawford, 15 votes for John Quincy Adams and 3 votes for Andrew Jackson.

The Bangor Register, November 18; The Intelligencer (Lexington, VA), November 13; and American, and Commercial Daily Advertiser (Baltimore, MD) lists 150 votes for William H. Crawford and 15 votes for John Quincy Adams.
The Daily National Intelligencer (Washington, DC), November 5 lists 150 votes for William H. Crawford, 15 votes for John Quincy Adams, and 4 for Andrew Jackson.
The United States Gazette (Philadelphia, PA): ".... In Henrico County, there were from 150 to 160 votes for William H. Crawford -- from 15 to 20 for John Quincy Adams -- and 4 for Andrew Jackson."

sub_unit.name: Henry
sub_unit.note: The Fincastle Mirror (Fincastle, VA), November 19 lists 76 votes for Andrew Jackson.

sub_unit.name: James City
sub_unit.note: The Richmond Enquirer (Richmond, VA), November 9, lists 0 votes for John Quincy Adams.

sub_unit.name: Jefferson
sub_unit.note: The Fincastle Mirror (Fincastle, VA), November 12; American, and Commercial Daily Advertiser (Baltimore, MD), and Baltimore Patriot and Mercantile Advertiser (Baltimore, MD). lists 28 votes for John Quincy Adams and 47 votes for Andrew Jackson.
The Daily National Intelligencer (Washington, DC) lists 28 votes for John Quincy Adams, 47 votes for Andrew Jackson, and 8 votes for Henry Clay.
The Alexandria Gazette and Advertiser (Alexandria, VA) lists 29 votes for John Quincy Adams and 49 votes for Andrew Jackson.

sub_unit.name: King George
sub_unit.note: The Richmond Enquirer (Richmond, VA), November 9 lists 1 vote for John Quincy Adams.

sub_unit.name: Lancaster
sub_unit.note: The Constitutional Whig (Richmond, VA), November 9 lists 0 votes for Andrew Jackson.

sub_unit.name: Loudoun
sub_unit.note: The Baltimore Patriot and Mercantile Advertiser (Baltimore, MD). lists 67 votes for William H. Crawford.

sub_unit.note: The Daily National Intelligencer (Washington, DC), November 8; Constitutional Whig (Richmond, VA), November 9; Fincastle Mirror (Fincastle, VA), November 19; American, and Commercial Daily Advertiser (Baltimore, MD), and Baltimore Patriot and Mercantile Advertiser (Baltimore, MD). lists 70 votes for William H. Crawford, 28 votes for John Quincy Adams and 18 votes for Andrew Jackson.
The Richmond Enquirer (Richmond, VA), November 12 lists 79 votes for William H. Crawford.

sub_unit.note: The Fincastle Mirror (Fincastle, VA), November 19 lists 5 votes for John Quincy Adams.

sub_unit.name: Mathews
sub_unit.note: The Constitutional Whig (Richmond, VA), November 9; and Fincastle Mirror (Fincastle, VA), November 19, list 46 votes for William H. Crawford and 19 votes for John Quincy Adams.

sub_unit.name: Monongalia
sub_unit.note: The Fincastle Mirror (Fincastle, VA), November 26 lists 15 votes for William H. Crawford.

sub_unit.name: Nelson
sub_unit.note: The Fincastle Mirror (Fincastle, VA), November 12 lists 70 votes for William H. Crawford, 57 votes for John Quincy Adams and 0 votes for Andrew Jackson.
The Intelligencer (Lexington, VA), November 13 lists 70 votes for William H. Crawford, 56 votes for John Quincy Adams and 0 votes for Andrew Jackson.
The Baltimore Patriot and Mercantile Advertiser (Baltimore, MD). lists 78 votes for William H. Crawford.
The Constitutional Whig (Richmond, VA) lists 70 votes for William H. Crawford, 56 votes for John Quincy Adams, and "uncertain" for Andrew Jackson.
The Alexandria Gazette and Advertiser (Alexandria, VA) lists 73 votes for William H. Crawford.

sub_unit.name: Ohio
sub_unit.note: The United States Gazette (Philadelphia, PA) lists 247 votes for Henry Clay.

sub_unit.name: Orange
sub_unit.note: The Constitutional Whig (Richmond, VA), November 9; Fincastle Mirror (Fincastle, VA), November 19 lists 104 votes for William H. Crawford, 21 votes for John Quincy Adams and 29 votes for Andrew Jackson.
The Intelligencer (Lexington, VA), November 13 lists 104 votes for William H. Crawford, 29 votes for John Quincy Adams and 21 votes for Andrew Jackson.

sub_unit.name: Patrick
sub_unit.note: The Fincastle Mirror (Fincastle, VA), November 19 lists 29 votes for William H. Crawford and 85 votes for Andrew Jackson.

sub_unit.name: Pendleton
sub_unit.note: The Fincastle Mirror (Fincastle, VA), November 19 lists 63 votes for John Quincy Adams and 5 votes for Andrew Jackson.

sub_unit.name: Pittslyvania
sub_unit.note: The Fincastle Mirror (Fincastle, VA), November 12; and The Intelligencer (Lexington, VA), November 13 lists 200 votes for William H. Crawford, 75 votes for John Quincy Adams and 40 votes for Andrew Jackson.
The Richmond Enquirer (Richmond, VA), November 9, lists 40 votes for Andrew Jackson.
The Constitutional Whig (Richmond, VA), November 9, lists 172 votes for William H. Crawford, 91 votes for John Quincy Adams, and 30 votes for Andrew Jackson.

sub_unit.name: Prince William
sub_unit.note: The Intelligencer (Lexington, VA), November 13 lists 8 votes for John Quincy Adams.
The Intelligencer (Lexington, VA): "Clay received 7 votes in Prince William and 1 in Fauquier."
The Daily National Intelligencer (Washington, DC), November 6; and Richmond Enquirer (Richmond, VA), November 12, list 7 votes for Henry Clay.

sub_unit.name: Princess Anne
sub_unit.note: The Constitutional Whig (Richmond, VA), November 9, Fincastle Mirror (Fincastle, VA), November 19 lists 141 votes for John Quincy Adams.
The Alexandria Gazette and Advertiser (Alexandria, VA) lists 143 for John Quincy Adams.

sub_unit.name: Richmond
sub_unit.note: The Alexandria Gazette and Advertiser (Alexandria, VA), November 4: "(one of these 110 had two of the Crawford Electors stuck out and in lieu of them substituted Judge Holmes on the Adams ticket and Judge Johnson on the Jackson ticket.) ... For at Ticket, for Gen. Robert B. Taylor and others -- 1."

sub_unit.name: Richmond
sub_unit.note: The On the Adams ticket: Pere B. Wethered received 13 votes and Peter B. Wethered received 5 votes.
The On the Jackson ticket: Capt. William Burton received 12 votes and Capt. William Benton received 4 votes.

The Constitutional Whig (Richmond, VA), November 9, Fincastle Mirror (Fincastle, VA), November 12, and American, and Commercial Daily Advertiser (Baltimore, MD) lists 16 votes for John Quincy Adams and 18 votes for Andrew Jackson.

sub_unit.name: Rockbridge
sub_unit.note: The Fincastle Mirror (Fincastle, VA), November 12 lists 48 votes for Andrew Jackson.
The Constitutional Whig (Richmond, VA), November 9 lists 130 votes for William H. Crawford, 140 votes for John Quincy Adams, and 100 votes for Andrew Jackson.

sub_unit.name: Rockingham
sub_unit.note: The Fincastle Mirror (Fincastle, VA), November 12 lists 83 votes for John Quincy Adams.

The Intelligencer (Lexington, VA), November 7; Alexandria Gazette and Advertiser (Alexandria, VA), American, and Commercial Daily Advertiser (Baltimore, MD) and Baltimore Patriot and Mercantile Advertiser (Baltimore, MD). list 178 votes for Andrew Jackson.
The Richmond Enquirer (Richmond, VA), November 9 lists 0 votes for John Quincy Adams.
The Constitutional Whig (Richmond, VA), November 12 lists 179 votes for Andrew Jackson, 0 votes for Henry Clay.

sub_unit.name: Shenandoah
sub_unit.note: The Daily National Intelligencer (Washington, DC), November 6; Constitutional Whig (Richmond, VA), November 9, Fincastle Mirror (Fincastle, VA), November 12, Bangor Register, November 18, The Intelligencer (Lexington, VA), November 13 and American, and Commercial Daily Advertiser (Baltimore, MD) lists 135 votes for William H. Crawford.
The Richmond Enquirer (Richmond, VA), November 9 lists 162 votes for William H. Crawford.

The Daily National Intelligencer (Washington, DC), November 6: "In the county of Shenandoah, which contains from 12 to 1400 freeholders, only 267 votes were given. A letter from that county estimates 900 voters in favor of Mr. Crawford, who did not go to the polls."

sub_unit.name: Southampton
sub_unit.note: The Fincastle Mirror (Fincastle, VA), November 19; American, and Commercial Daily Advertiser (Baltimore, MD), and Baltimore Patriot and Mercantile Advertiser (Baltimore, MD). lists 138 votes for William H. Crawford.
The Daily National Intelligencer (Washington, DC), November 8; and Constitutional Whig (Richmond, VA), November 12 list 138 votes for William H. Crawford, and 33 votes for John Quincy Adams.

sub_unit.name: Spotsylvania
sub_unit.note: The Daily National Intelligencer (Washington, DC), November 5; Bangor Register, November 18; American, and Commercial Daily Advertiser (Baltimore, MD) and Baltimore Patriot and Mercantile Advertiser (Baltimore, MD). lists 161 votes for William H. Crawford, 46 votes for John Quincy Adams and 93 votes for Andrew Jackson.
The Constitutional Whig (Richmond, VA), November 9; Richmond Enquirer (Richmond, VA), November 9; and Fincastle Mirror (Fincastle, VA), November 19, list 90 votes for Andrew Jackson.

sub_unit.name: Stafford
sub_unit.note: The Fincastle Mirror (Fincastle, VA), November 12 lists 26 votes for John Quincy Adams.

The Daily National Intelligencer (Washington, DC), November 5, Bangor Register, November 18, and American, and Commercial Daily Advertiser (Baltimore, MD) list 50 votes for William H. Crawford and 23 votes for Andrew Jackson.
The Constitutional Whig (Richmond, VA) lists 0 votes for Andrew Jackson.

sub_unit.name: Sussex
sub_unit.note: The Fincastle Mirror (Fincastle, VA), November 19 lists 98 votes for William H. Crawford.

The Daily National Intelligencer (Washington, DC), November 8; American, and Commercial Daily Advertiser (Baltimore, MD), and Baltimore Patriot and Mercantile Advertiser (Baltimore, MD). list 87 votes for William H. Crawford.

sub_unit.name: Warwick
sub_unit.note: The Constitutional Whig (Richmond, VA), November 9; and Fincastle Mirror (Fincastle, VA), November 19, list 33 votes for William H. Crawford.

sub_unit.name: Westmoreland
sub_unit.note: The Constitutional Whig (Richmond, VA), November 9; Fincastle Mirror (Fincastle, VA), November 12; and The Intelligencer (Lexington, VA), November 13, list 46 votes for William H. Crawford, 16 votes for John Quincy Adams and 18 votes for Andrew Jackson.

sub_unit.name: Williamsburg
sub_unit.note: At the time, Williamsburg was split between James City County and York County and was not yet an independent city. The votes in Williamsburg appear to have been reported independently of either county.
